page.title: 16EVENTS IN FYLINGDALES
page.content: Every year we have the Fylingdales Show which is an exhibition of craft work in the Parish Hall. On display are over 300 pictures and models by the local primary school children. The adult classes cover knitting, embroidery and dressmaking. The horticultural part of the show is later in the year when the classes are for fruit, vegetables and flowers. The May Queen for the year processes in a decorated lorry from the boat landing in Robin Hoods Bay up to St. Stephen's Church, followed by the villagers who carry posies. Each year the May Queen wears a pretty white nylon dress with a garland round her neck and carries a posy. The Vicar meets her and shows her to the throne where the retiring May Queen crowns her. Afterwards the Fylingdales School children give a
